PROMPT.SMARTCARD.DESCRIPTION: Cryptographic smart cards are often used for single sign-on. Most advanced smart cards include specialized cryptographic hardware that uses algorithms such as RSA and DSA. Today's cryptographic smart cards generate key pairs on board, to avoid the risk fr
PROMPT.PINCODE.DESCRIPTION: A keystore is a repository of security certificates, either Certification Authority Certificates or Public key certificates - used for instance in SSL encryption. In application servers, a file with extension jks serves as keystore. The Java JDK maintains
PROMPT.ESEAL.DESCRIPTION: Advanced electronic signature provided by DiSP is compliant with Article 3 (16) of the Provisions on Electronic Documents adopted by the Bureau of the European Parliament on 1 October 2018; and in accordance with Article 3 (26) of the Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 July 2014 on Electronic Identification and Trust Services for Electronic Transactions in the Internal Market.
PROMPT.QESEAL.DESCRIPTION: Qualified electronic seal provided by DiSP is compliant with Article 3 (17) of the Provisions on Electronic Documents adopted by the Bureau of the European Parliament on 1 October 2018; and in accordance with Article 3 (27) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 July 2014 on Electronic Identification and Trust Services for Electronic Transactions in the Internal Market
PROMPT.EFAST.DESCRIPTION: The Fast electronic signature provided by DiSP is compliant with Article 3 (16) of the Provisions on Electronic Documents adopted by the Bureau of the European Parliament on 1 October 2018. It allows users to quickly sign documents by relying on the authentication already made by the Single Sign On mechanism of the European Parliament. The usage of this signature mode shall be enabled for documents only in agreement with the corresponding process owner and particularly in relation with Article 26 (d) of the Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 July 2014
PROMPT.ISSUER.NOT.TRUSTED.COMMENT: The issuer of a certificate used for the signature of the document was not in the list of trusted authorities.
PROMPT.CERTIFICATE.REVOKED.COMMENT: The certificate used for signing the document was revoked at the time of signing.

You will delete the document from the Digital Signature Portal (DISP) and it will no longer be available for anyone.
This action is irreversible. If you do not want to delete the file click "Cancel".
If you want to save the file on your computer before you delete it from DISP, please use the button "Download".
REQUESTS_ACTION_BAR.PURGE.COMMENT.EMPTY: To delete the file please provide brief instructions (e.g. an external reference) about how the signed file can be found in future, and click the button "Purge".

CERTIFY_DOCUMENT.INTRO: Select a PDF file to certify the integrity of a document with DISP Advanced E-Signature certificate in the terms of Art. 9 (2) of the Provisions on Electronic Documents of the European Parliament. The integrity of this electronic document will be evidenced by an encoded electronic fingerprint that ensures that any subsequent modification of the document is detectable.

TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.TITLE: Token Help Page
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.INTRO_TEXT:
We are sorry you have issues with the Token.
 Below is the list of the frequently asked questions - with answers.
The list will grow in time, as we learn what are the most common problems.
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.Q1: Why do I need the authenticate with the Token?
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.A1: There are private documents that can only be presented to a user if a Token authentication took place. It is another layer of security to ensure that only the individual owning the Token can access them.
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.Q2: I don't have the Token yet. How do I get one? Do I even need one?
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.A2: You must contact xxxx service to obtain a Token or discuss if you need one.
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.Q3: What do I need to type into the Token field?
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.A3: Take your 4 digit Token PIN and append the Token Code. If your PIN is '1234' and the Token Generated Code is '129 759' - you must type '1234129759' as one continuous string of 10 digits.
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.Q4: I have typed the code as explained, but it has not work.
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.A4: The Token Generated Code is time limited. Type the code and click "Verify" button before the Token changes the code.
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.Q5: I might have entered the code wrong few times.
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.A5: If more than 3 wrong attempts have been made, there is an automatic security protection that blocks the Token assigned to your account. Please contact ITEC Service Desk to re-activate the Token - tel.: 84300.
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.Q6: There is something else that is wrong with my Token
TOKEN.HELP_MODAL.QA.A6: Please contact directly ITEC Service Desk for further assistance - tel.: 84300.

EDIT_REQUEST.OPEN_REQUEST.POPUP.DESCRIPT:
Requests with an open signatories list allow invitation of anybody as additional signatory by simply forwarding the link provided in the notification email. Signing will be possible even if the person was not originally listed in the invitation.

Open signatories list is available only for signature types in parallel mode.

DEADLINE.NOT.IN.INTERVAL: Deadline should be in the allowed interval.
REQUEST.LOCATE_SIGNATURE.INFO_PANEL.BTN_: Click in the following button to add the visual stamp to the attached document
REQUEST.LOCATE_SIGNATURE.INFO_PANEL.VISU: Note: The Visual Stamp won't appear on the next pages of the document if there isn't enough space on the selected page.
Visual Stamp Location contains two pieces of information.
Number of the Page: The selected number of the page where you want to visualize the visual stamp (Signature Stamp on paper).
The coordinate: The horizontal (X) and vertical (Y) positions related to the visual stamp on paper.
REQUEST.LOCATE_SIGNATURE.SAVE.SUCCESS: Your signature have been successfully updated.
